hypothesis_content.title: Bull-to-Stress Transition via Volatility Compression Break
hypothesis_content.statement: In BULL regimes, when the 10-day Bollinger Band width for BTC reaches a 30-day low (compression < 0.15) while the Crypto Fear & Greed Index is >75 (Extreme Greed), a breakout below the lower band triggers a STRESS regime within 2 days, benefiting short-volatility strategies on memecoins (PEPE, DOGE).
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extreme greed with volatility compression creates a fragile equilibrium. Breakdown from compression in bull markets often triggers sharp, short-lived stress events. High-beta memecoins experience exaggerated volatility mean reversion.
entry_conditions: BTC closes below 10-day lower Bollinger Band

exit_conditions.take_profit: PEPE 5-day realized volatility drops below 80% OR 5 days elapsed

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakdown fails to trigger STRESS regime >50% of the time, or memecoin volatility continues expanding post-breakdown.
